thread.title: Report: Eagles QB Chase Daniel Drawing Trade Interest
thread.title_full: Report: Eagles QB Chase Daniel Drawing Trade Interest

author: CBS Philly
title: Report: Eagles QB Chase Daniel Drawing Trade Interest
text:
Report: Eagles QB Chase Daniel Drawing Trade Interest March 2, 2017 10:20 AM By Andrew Porter Chase Daniel #10 of the Philadelphia Eagles (Photo by Mitchell Leff/Getty Images) 
PHILADELPHIA (CBS) — The Eagles may be able to trade their backup quarterback. 
Related: 94WIP Birds Town Hall Recap 
According to a report from the NFL.com’s Ian Rapoport, Chase Daniel is “drawing interest on the trade market.” One backup QB drawing interest on the trade market: #Eagles QB Chase Daniel. As teams try to improve there, Daniel is one to watch. 
— Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) March 2, 2017 
The Eagles signed Daniel last offseason to a three-year deal worth $21 million, with $12 million guaranteed. About a week before the regular season, the Eagles traded Sam Bradford and named rookie quarterback Carson Wentz as their starter. 
The Eagles have about $12 million in cap space as it stands right now, which is third least in the league, to go along with eight draft picks in the 2017 draft. 
Daniel has a cap hit of $8 million for each of the next two seasons.
